Show HN: Product Requirement Docs Using AI
text:
As a product manager, I have always wished to automate some of the repetitive tasks. With GPT-3 & ChatGPT being so accessible, I created this app which creates a Product requirement doc.

It generates PRD following Lenny's Rachitsky template - https://docs.google.com/document/d/1541V32QgSwyCFWxtiMIThn-6...

Do try it out and let me know your feedback :)

title: Ask HN: How to avoid being scammed when applying for a fully remote role
text:
I work in a fully remote company and I'm very happy there (not looking to move at all). But having seen so many ChatGPT articles got me thinking "nothing would have really stopped my current job from being a very sophisticated scam".

I know this is the best protection, the fact that creating a perfectly fake company is difficult but not impossible at all.

Most official info like company name/number can just belong to another company, you can register a domain with let's encrypt, you can even have a decent recruitment process.

Smaller companies tend to have almost no official social presence (I have worked for a couple with very little).

At some point they need to ask for money or something and then you will definitely know you have been scammed but by then you might have given notice in your old place and the damage would have been done. They would have also got hold of a lot of private sensitive info like passport numbers, etc.

What I would do if I find myself in the market again is to ask to see a demo of the application/product (this is something I would encourage people to do regardless). If they are going to go to the extent of creating a real app that is not obviously some templated stuff then it must be almost certainly real.

What else could be a good strategy to avoid being scammed while looking for fully remote roles?

Show HN: A battle game for any of your EVM blockchain NFTs
text:
Hey everybody, I've been building a battle game where the world of NFTs meets Super Smash Bros. It works with most standard ERC721 NFTs on Ethereum, Polygon, and Arbitrum. The game takes your NFT, crops it, and puts it into a mech suit with guns.

I'm still building out the features such as multiplayer and custom mech suits and additional power ups. If you are into NFTs I would love you to try out this early single player version and give me your feedback.

Show HN: Open-source tool to find PII across data silos
text:
Hey everyone! I’ve been working on a tool to scan for and map PII across DBs/warehouses/SaaS’s, as well as to automate user data deletion/export in these silos; right now it integrates with ~10 different data silos.

It’s locally deployable, so you can spin it up privately and make a map of where sensitive data is fairly quickly. It’s also extensible; you can add new connectors easily (following our connector development guide at https://docs.monoid.co), though we’re also adding new connectors weekly. If you'd like to play with the tool without having to deploy, you can check out a read-only demo at https://demo.monoid.co

We’re hoping that this provides a solid foundation for teams that build internal maps of user data for CCPA/GDPR compliance, and who aren’t fans of using cloud solutions (e.g. OneTrust) to integrate with sensitive data silos.

Feedback would be much appreciated!

title: Ask HN: Should Hacker News add Sort-By-Controversial comment sorting?
text:
Would you use Sort-By-Controversial comment sorting?

Context: Interesting & creative comments get pushed down on Hackernews due to popularity-based sorting. Reddit offers sort-by-controversial which highlights more creative & stimulating comments. I would like to see that applied to Hackernews threads.

Is it worth asking the team to add this feature?
